title: Fix build in today's world
message:
Fix build in today's world

It's kind of strange I need to do this, it worked just fine a few months
ago. :-(

title: Put {enable,disable}PeriodicUpdatesReceiver back
message:
Put {enable,disable}PeriodicUpdatesReceiver back

This is needed after all. It seemed to work even without this, but we
were receiving the updates all the time even when the addon was supposed
to be closed, and it's likely this was a one time thing on my phone and
it wouldn't work at all for others.

title: Workaround for periodic updates not working with Locus 3.24.2
message: Workaround for periodic updates not working with Locus 3.24.2

title: Show navigation page 100 meters before turns
message:
Show navigation page 100 meters before turns

With the ability to add custom navigation points along a track this can
actually be really useful.

title: Revert back to wahoo api 1.5.1.14
message:
Revert back to wahoo api 1.5.1.14

Anything newer is a stinking pile of crap that misses display updates no
matter how many workarounds I try and Wahoo hasn't responded so far. :-(

This reverts commit b16985a56c67aff9d9634bc5d53a5f2fbd715e81.
This reverts commit 9653a85d2d3a83f80a34080231c5659eb8a83104.
This reverts commit 92ce949c7cacb96b14a9ebc82c0374221f1b84e7.
This reverts commit 0f0b5c3f5980e49a8757861766d5d5683ffde03c.
This reverts commit 890f1c46e7b289d67b1d0124e3ee74cc567a6b65.

title: Another (manual) workaround for lost display updates
message:
Another (manual) workaround for lost display updates

Apparently resetting the display 5 seconds after onLoadComplete isn't
reliable enough, so let's just add a button for invoking the display
reset manually. :-(

title: Workaround for lost display updates
message:
Workaround for lost display updates

Since wahoo_fitness_android_api_1.7.1.5, display updates sent
immediately after onLoadComplete get lost. :-(

title: Hopefully fix a reported crash
message:
Hopefully fix a reported crash

(I fucking hate the nonresponsiveness of Wahoo. Normally I'd ask for a
proguard config, but here I have to just blindly try random options and
hope for the best. Fuck you Wahoo, fuck you very much.)

message: Pretty dialogs before asking for permission/location

title: Deal with hwCon.startDiscovery errors (Android 6 permissions fix)
message:
Deal with hwCon.startDiscovery errors (Android 6 permissions fix)

Android 6 needs a separate user interaction to grant the location
permissions necessary for BTLE discovery to work. While at it, handle
error cases like disabled location/bluetooth as well.

title: Drop NoAnalytics, apprarently no longer necessary
message: Drop NoAnalytics, apprarently no longer necessary

title: build: Back to SDK 23, Google Play won't let me downgrade the app
message: build: Back to SDK 23, Google Play won't let me downgrade the app

title: Update all values upon RFLKT connection
message:
Update all values upon RFLKT connection

This makes it possible to have service traits that don't call setRflkt
every second, like BatteryService. Before, if setRflkt was called
without a connected RFLKT, the update would be ignored. Now we keep all
the values and update them upon connection to RFLKT.

title: build: Disable protify
message:
build: Disable protify

It slows down the build and produces crashing apks whenever I do
android:package twice (or android:install, or whatever). Doing it once
and then using protify used to work, but now that doesn't work either,
leaving the old code running. No time to debug/report this. :-(

title: Do not crash if Locus not installed
message:
Do not crash if Locus not installed

Show a dialog and bring user to Google Play instead. Also handle disabled
periodic updates similarly.

title: Always use the text-based roundabout instead of icon-based
message:
Always use the text-based roundabout instead of icon-based

Those icons weren't any nicer and cause an additional minute of loading time.

title: More robust confirmation/loading
message:
More robust confirmation/loading

This should minimize the number of times I need to manually disconnect and
reconnect the device in various pathological scenarios.

Add possibility to use a reduced set of navigation icons

This loads quite a bit faster than the full set.

message:
Drop software page left/right functions

After previous commit, this is safe as it won't break existing users.
Unfortunately the preferences screen will show "%s" instead of "Page left",
but configuration for RFLKT will be constructed correctly and the device will
do what it should.

title: Further discovery/connect/disconnect improvements
message:
Further discovery/connect/disconnect improvements

Shows various status messages during connection, confirmation, loading pages,
etc.

One remaining issue is that if bluetooth is not enabled, first click on
discovery will only trigger the "enable bluetooth" dialog but discovery will
stay disabled. Shouldn't be a problem for most people though.

title: Fix proguard cache
message:
Fix proguard cache

com.google stuff is now in our classes.jar so any change anywhere triggered
proguard.

message:

Probably not worth the code complexity required to do it right.

title: Replace libGoogleAnalyticsServices.jar with NoAnalytics
message:
Replace libGoogleAnalyticsServices.jar with NoAnalytics

Using libGoogleAnalyticsServices.jar was likely in conflict with the GPL used
in some parts of Locus API. Wahoo's androidapi.jar is still problematic, but I
think we can get an exception from Locus copyright holders for that, if
necessary.

Thanks a lot to @JavaJens for the idea.

title: Mention Locus APIs in License dialog
message: Mention Locus APIs in License dialog

title: Add button configuration to settings
message:
Add button configuration to settings

More importantly, this brings some abstractions that make adding additional
settings quite easy. Now I just need to figure out how to deal with
adding/removing pages and create abstractions for page templates.

title: Add option to show license and give credit to both macroid/scaloid
message: Add option to show license and give credit to both macroid/scaloid

title: Better service lifecycle
message:
Better service lifecycle

Only put the service in foreground if connecting/connected.
Stop the service on exit from activity if not connecting/connected.

Move "stop all" aka Quit to the menu

This is hopefully temporary, manual termination of the service is slightly
annoying.

title: Tweak build.sbt a bit
message:
Tweak build.sbt a bit

Fixed android-sdk-plugin means we can drop the proguardCache workaround and
now that we're at it, start using it for all libraries. Also, drop some
unnecessary proguard options and enable optimization/obfuscation for release
builds.

title: Prevent being killed by Android

Before this just taking a photo killed the service, now it survives taking a

reconnect if it ever really does get killed, but this will have to do for now.
